* Model: A105-S361
* Website: http://www.mysimon.com/Toshiba_Satellite_A105_S361_Pentium_M_760_2_GHz_15_4_TFT/4014-3121_8-31660111.html?showspecs=1

=== Current Issues ===
* '''Critical:''' Shutdown didn't power off. System say is halted, but do not power off: Bug# <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/distros/ubuntu/+source/linux-source-2.6.15/+bug/43961|43961]]</nowiki>, as <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux-source-2.6.15/+bug/43961/comments/21|confirmed by Ahmed Kamal in bug comments]]</nowiki>;
** How to fix: Add /sbin/rmmod snd_hda_intel added to the end of /etc/default/halt. Worked in Ubuntu Desktop 7.10 Gutsy Gibbon, running from LiveCD.
* '''Moderate:''' Touchpad's scroll not working "out of the box": Bug# <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/distros/ubuntu/+source/linux-source-2.6.15/+bug/66417|66417]]</nowiki>;

==== Notes ====
Linux on laptop: http://linux-laptop.net/hosted/toshiba-A105-S361-SuSE10.html

How to solve Synaptics Touchpad Issue:
Edit /etc/X11/xorg.conf adding:
<pre>
...
Section "InputDevice"
	Identifier 	"Synaptics Touchpad"
	Driver 		"synaptics"
	Option 		"SendCoreEvents" 	"true"
	Option 		"Device" 		"/dev/psaux"
	Option 		"Protocol" 		"auto-dev"
	Option 		"HorizScrollDelta" 	"0"
EndSection
...
Section "ServerLayout"
	...
	InputDevice	"Synaptics Touchpad"
	...
EndSection
</pre>
About <nowiki>[[http://web.telia.com/~u89404340/touchpad/|Synaptics Touchpad config params]]</nowiki>:
